Interactive map, Flint and Detroit points
'''Michigan rap''' is a subgenre of [[Midwestern hip-hop]] in the United States, including Detroit rap, Flint rap, and a style characterized by its "underdog spirit." Pivotal figures in the emergence of Michigan and Midwestern hip-hop scene include [[J Dilla]], [[Eminem]], [[MC Breed]], and [[Big Sean]]. In 2023, ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' described Michigan rap as "the regional style of intense punchlines and goofy music videos".
